And so what I'm asking myself is how

get all of them? Actually this is
something that people have tried to do

came out talked about how it would cost
about $1,000 to fill the album. And I see

to give us a different way of thinking

that that estimate of a thousand
dollars assumes that you're just buying
and buying and buying and buying

and so whenever you get repeats and they
get repeats then you're able to swap
with each other and that way you're

I'm just going to imagine that I'm that

between the ith new sticker and the i
plus one new sticker, okay? So for example
N0 will be how many stickers until
I get the first new one. N1 will be

how many times until I get the second 
new one.

So I'm looking for for some new one that
I that I don't have in my album yet. And

try to find each one of these numbers.

to go right away. And so when I average

which is 682,
well that average is going to be how

so this equation is just saying this is
equal to 1 plus 200 over 682 times N of
200. What I get is that the number of

is that n is equal to 682 over 682 plus
